title: Wireguard Helm Chart Values
description: Schema for values.yaml of the Wireguard chart. Descriptions are based on comments in values.yaml.

image.title: Container Image Settings
image.description: Settings for the container image used.

repository.title: Image Repository
repository.description: Container image repository, e.g. linuxserver/wireguard. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/

pullPolicy.title: Image Pull Policy
pullPolicy.description: Pull policy for the container image. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/

imagePullSecrets.title: Image Pull Secrets
imagePullSecrets.description: Secrets for pulling images from private repositories. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/

replicaCount.title: Replica Count
replicaCount.description: Number of replicas for the deployment. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicaset/

dnsPolicy.title: DNS Policy
dnsPolicy.description: Pod dnsPolicy. Defaults to ClusterFirst. Use None to supply custom dnsConfig.

dnsConfig.title: DNS Config
dnsConfig.description: Pod dnsConfig. Note: custom nameservers generally require dnsPolicy: None. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/dns-pod-service/

hostNetwork.title: Host Network
hostNetwork.description: If true, the pod will use the host's network namespace (hostNetwork: true).

type.title: Update Strategy Type
type.description: Type of update strategy (e.g. RollingUpdate or Recreate). Note: Use Recreate for PVCs that cannot be mounted by multiple pods.

initContainers.title: Init Containers
initContainers.description: Kubernetes initContainers list. Each item is a standard container spec.

sidecars.title: Sidecar Containers
sidecars.description: Additional containers to run alongside the main container.

wireguard.title: Wireguard Settings
wireguard.description: Specific configuration for Wireguard server and client.

dns.title: DNS Server
dns.description: Optional DNS servers in peer/client configuration. Server default: auto. Client default: 1.1.1.1, 2606:4700:4700::1111

allowedIPs.title: Allowed IPs
allowedIPs.description: IPs/networks reachable via VPN connection. Default: 0.0.0.0/0, ::0/0 (routes all traffic through VPN). For split tunneling, set only required networks including server WG IP.

extraEnvVars.title: Additional Environment Variables
extraEnvVars.description: Extra environment variables for the Wireguard container.

name.title: Environment Variable Name
name.description: Name of the additional environment variable for the Wireguard container.

value.title: Environment Variable Value
value.description: Value of the additional environment variable for the Wireguard container.

extraEnvVarsSecret.title: Extra EnvVars Secret
extraEnvVarsSecret.description: Name of an existing secret with additional environment variables for the Wireguard container.

extraEnvVarsCM.title: Extra EnvVars ConfigMap
extraEnvVarsCM.description: Name of an existing ConfigMap with additional environment variables for the Wireguard container.

existingSecret.title: Existing Wireguard Secret
existingSecret.description: Name of an existing secret for the complete Wireguard configuration (stringData wg0.conf). Ignores server/client configuration if set.

PUID.title: Process User ID
PUID.description: User ID for the main process (linuxserver default: 1000). Optional.

PGID.title: Process Group ID
PGID.description: Group ID for the main process (linuxserver default: 1000). Optional.

enabled.title: Server Mode Enabled
enabled.description: Enables Wireguard server mode. Cannot be active at the same time as wireguard.client.enabled.

storage.title: Wireguard Server Storage
storage.description: Storage settings for Wireguard server configuration.

existingClaim.title: Existing PVC
existingClaim.description: Name of an existing PersistentVolumeClaim for Wireguard configuration.

accessModes.title: Access Modes
accessModes.description: Access modes for the persistent volume (e.g. ReadWriteOnce).

resourcePolicy.title: Resource Policy
resourcePolicy.description: Resource policy of the PVC (e.g. keep).

address.title: External Address
address.description: External IP or domain for the Wireguard server. If 'auto', IP is determined automatically.

peers.title: Peers
peers.description: Number of peer configurations to create or comma-separated list of names (alphanumeric). Default: 1

subnet.title: Internal Subnet
subnet.description: Internal subnet for Wireguard server and peers (Default 10.13.13.0/24). Change only if it collides.

keepalivePeers.title: Keepalive Peers
keepalivePeers.description: 'all' or comma-separated list (e.g. 1,4,laptop) to which the server sends keepalives every 25s. Useful for dynamic IP.

peerQR.title: Peer QR in Log
peerQR.description: Shows generated QR codes in the log. false to skip log output. Default false.

enabled.title: Client Mode Enabled
enabled.description: Enables Wireguard client mode. Cannot be active at the same time as wireguard.server.enabled.

existingSecret.title: Existing Client Secret
existingSecret.description: Secret name for the peer configuration (Keys: privatekey, publickey, presharedkey).

preUp.title: Hook preUp
preUp.description: Command executed before interface is brought up (client preUp).

postUp.title: Hook postUp
postUp.description: Command executed after interface is brought up (client postUp).

preDown.title: Hook preDown
preDown.description: Command executed before interface is brought down (client preDown).

postDown.title: Hook postDown
postDown.description: Command executed after interface is brought down (client postDown).

persistentKeepalive.title: Persistent Keepalive
persistentKeepalive.description: Keepalive in seconds (0 to disable, Default 25).

endpoint.title: Server Endpoint
endpoint.description: Endpoint IP/hostname with port of the Wireguard server (e.g. vpn.example.com:51820).

create.title: Create
create.description: Indicates whether a ServiceAccount should be created.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: Annotations to add to the ServiceAccount.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the ServiceAccount to use. If empty and create=true, a name is generated.

securityContext.title: Container Security Context
securityContext.description: SecurityContext at container level (e.g. NET_ADMIN, SYS_MODULE, runAsUser, privileged).

privileged.title: Privileged
privileged.description: Run the container in privileged mode.

allowPrivilegeEscalation.title: Allow Privilege Escalation
allowPrivilegeEscalation.description: Whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent.

readOnlyRootFilesystem.title: Read-only Root Filesystem
readOnlyRootFilesystem.description: Whether the root filesystem should be mounted read-only.

runAsNonRoot.title: Run as Non-root
runAsNonRoot.description: Whether the container should run as a non-root user.

runAsUser.title: Run as User
runAsUser.description: The UID to run the container as.

seccompProfile.title: Seccomp Profile
seccompProfile.description: The seccomp profile to use for the container.

type.description: The type of seccomp profile to use.

localhostProfile.description: The path to a custom seccomp profile on the node.

capabilities.title: Linux Capabilities
capabilities.description: Linux capabilities to add or drop.

nodePort.title: NodePort
nodePort.description: Fixed NodePort (only for service type NodePort).

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Resource limits/requests (limits, requests). Left empty by default.

customLivenessProbe.title: Custom Liveness Probe
customLivenessProbe.description: Overrides the default liveness probe for Wireguard.

customReadinessProbe.title: Custom Readiness Probe
customReadinessProbe.description: Overrides the default readiness probe for Wireguard.

customStartupProbe.title: Custom Startup Probe
customStartupProbe.description: Overrides the default startup probe for Wireguard.

extraVolumes.title: Additional Volumes
extraVolumes.description: Additional volumes in the deployment definition.

extraVolumeMounts.title: Additional VolumeMounts
extraVolumeMounts.description: Additional volume mounts in the deployment definition.
